unnormalised: New Delhi: Today marks a significant anniversary in Indian history. 26/01 is celebrated annually as Republic Day, commemorating the date the Constitution of India came into effect in 1950, replacing the Government of India Act 1935 as the governing document of India.
normalised: New Delhi: Today marks a significant anniversary in Indian history. twenty sixth january is celebrated annually as Republic Day, commemorating the date the Constitution of India came into effect in one thousand nine hundred and fifty, replacing the Government of India Act one thousand nine hundred and thirty five as the governing document of India.

unnormalised: The Constituent Assembly adopted the Constitution on 26/11/1949, but it was officially enforced on 26th Jan 1950. This date was chosen because it was on this day in 1930 that the Declaration of Indian Independence (Purna Swaraj) was proclaimed by the Indian National Congress.
normalised: The Constituent Assembly adopted the Constitution on twenty sixth november one thousand nine hundred and forty nine, but it was officially enforced on twenty sixth January one thousand nine hundred and fifty. This date was chosen because it was on this day in one thousand nine hundred and thirty that the Declaration of Indian Independence (Purna Swaraj) was proclaimed by the Indian National Congress.

unnormalised: This year's celebrations will include a parade at Kartavya Path, showcasing India's military strength and cultural diversity. The President of India will preside over the event, with dignitaries from various nations in attendance. The parade is scheduled to begin at 09:30 hrs IST.
normalised: This year's celebrations will include a parade at Kartavya Path, showcasing India's military strength and cultural diversity. The President of India will preside over the event, with dignitaries from various nations in attendance. The parade is scheduled to begin at nine thirty hours I-S-T.

unnormalised: Furthermore, numerous cultural programmes and events are planned across the country to mark the occasion. State governments and local communities are organizing flag hoisting ceremonies and patriotic performances. Many schools are preponing events to 25/01 due to weather predictions.
normalised: Furthermore, numerous cultural programmes and events are planned across the country to mark the occasion. State governments and local communities are organizing flag hoisting ceremonies and patriotic performances. Many schools are preponing events to twenty fifth january due to weather predictions.

unnormalised: The Ministry of Culture has announced a series of online and offline events, including exhibitions and workshops, to educate citizens about the history and significance of Republic Day. The theme for this year's celebrations is "India@75: A Journey of Progress and Development," recognizing 75 years of independence since 15/08/1947.
normalised: The Ministry of Culture has announced a series of online and offline events, including exhibitions and workshops, to educate citizens about the history and significance of Republic Day. The theme for this year's celebrations is "India at seventy five: A Journey of Progress and Development," recognizing seventy five years of independence since fifteenth august one thousand nine hundred and forty seven.
